176.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut has been sent to judicial custody till August 22 in a money laundering case. He was arrested by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) last Sunday. The probe agency has claimed that some of the properties bought by Raut involved substantial cash transactions. The ED has also questioned Raut’s wife in connection with the same case.

177.title: Vishwa Sanatan Parishad demands demolition of B'luru's Idgah Maidan tower
177.article_body: Vishwa Sanatan Parishad President Bhaskaran on Monday said the organisation will write to Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike and the state government and file a petition to take down Idgah Maidan tower. "If Idgah tower is allowed to stand there, which is now revenue department's property, it'll...lead to communal clashes," he said. Tower must be demolished in society's interest, he added.

178.title: Man caught with Bluetooth speakers during civil service exam in Pune
178.article_body: A 30-year-old man was caught using banned electronic devices at a Maharashtra Public Service Commission (MPSC) exam venue in Pune and was later arrested for violating norms prescribed by the commission. The aspirant was caught carrying a mobile phone and Bluetooth micro speakers inside the examination hall. He has been booked under the relevant sections of the IPC.

179.title: Dharma didn't tell me before using my vocals in 'Nach Punjaban': Gippy
179.article_body: Punjabi actor-singer Gippy Grewal has revealed that Dharma Productions did not inform him before using his vocals in the 'JugJugg Jeeyo' song 'The Punjaabban Song'. "Nobody called me for three months...I assumed...they didn't use it...They had obviously used it...Their entire promotion was based on the song, nobody said who sang it. I don't know what competition they had," he added.

180.title: Rise of elements like PFI in Rajasthan has CM's blessing: Rathore
180.article_body: BJP MP Rajyavardhan Singh Rathore has said that the alleged rise of extremist elements, including the Popular Front of India (PFI), in Rajasthan has the blessing of CM Ashok Gehlot. Reacting to Gehlot's statement on the increase in rape incidents, Rathore added, "State government is trying to hide their failures in stopping the increasing [rape] incidents [by giving such statements]."

181.title: Neighbour repeatedly rapes 15-year-old girl in Pune, arrested
181.article_body: Pune Police have arrested a rape accused for allegedly sexually assaulting his 15-year-old neighbour on several occasions. According to the complaint, the accused had allegedly barged inside the girl's house and assaulted her for the first time in February. In July, the accused and his friend also allegedly abducted the girl and kept her hostage in Mumbai.

182.title: Devotees offer prayers on last 'Sawan Monday' across country
182.article_body: On the fourth and last Monday in the holy month of Sawan, devotees visited temples across the country to offer their prayers. Sawan is considered to be the most auspicious month for devotees. It is dedicated to Lord Shiva who is worshipped during this month. The worshippers observe fast on each Mondays which fall in Sawan month.

183.title: India's Yastika falls while walking out to bat during CWG cricket final, video goes viral
183.article_body: A video has gone viral showing India's Yastika Bhatia tripping on advertising boards and falling while walking out to bat during the CWG women's cricket final against Australia. In the video, her teammates can be seen laughing in the dugout as she falls. Yastika was included in playing XI as concussion substitute for Taniya Bhatia, who was hit on helmet.

184.title: Shoaib Akhtar undergoes his 6th knee surgery, shares video from hospital bed
184.article_body: Ex-Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar underwent his sixth knee surgery in Melbourne. He took to Instagram to share a video from the hospital bed, revealing the surgery took around 5-6 hours to complete. "Hopefully...it's my last surgery...Even after 11 years since retiring...I'm in pain," he said. He added that he could have played more cricket if not for his knee issues.

185.title: SoftBank posts record quarterly loss of $23 billion as tech stocks tumble
185.article_body: SoftBank Group has reported a record loss for the second straight quarter amid a selloff in global tech stocks. The Japanese conglomerate's net loss for the quarter ended June stood at 3.16 trillion yen ($23.4 billion). Meanwhile, its Vision Fund unit posted a quarterly loss of 2.33 trillion yen ($17.23 billion). SoftBank has backed several Indian startups, like Paytm, PolicyBazaar.

186.title: In my head, I've slept with hundreds of women: Elon Musk's 76-year-old father
186.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk's 76-year-old father Errol remarked, "In my head, I've slept with hundreds of women. Occasionally I find a woman that is attracted to me." He also denied being a serial womaniser. Errol had recently revealed that he had a second child with his 35-year-old stepdaughter Jana Bezuidenhout in 2019 and that they are not living together anymore.

187.title: We made mistakes in final few overs: Harmanpreet after CWG final loss vs Aus
187.article_body: After India Women won the silver medal following their nine-run loss against Australia in gold medal match at CWG 2022, India skipper Harmanpreet Kaur said her side made some mistakes in the final few overs of the match. "We had full control of the game...should've been more calculated," she added. Chasing 162, India were dismissed for 152 in 19.3 overs.

188.title: 21-yr-old sailor cheated of ₹1.46 lakh in job fraud scam in Mumbai
188.article_body: A 21-year-old sailor of the Indian Coast Guard (ICG) was cheated in a social media job fraud scam on Friday, while he was admitted to INHS Asvini military hospital in Mumbai's Colaba. The sailor, in his complaint, revealed that he received a link on Telegram, following which he was asked to pay money to secure a part-time job.

189.title: UP man argues about water priced at ₹20 & not ₹15, thrown off moving train
189.article_body: A man from Jhansi was thrown off a running train in Uttar Pradesh's Lalitpur after he got into an argument with pantry staff over the price of a water bottle. In his complaint, the man said that he got into an argument with a vendor selling bottled water for ₹20, while the railways has fixed the price at ₹15.

190.title: upGrad raises $210 mn in funding led by ETS Global, Bodhi Tree
190.article_body: Edtech unicorn upGrad has secured $210 million funding at $2.25 billion valuation. upGrad founders invested $12.5 million in this funding round to maintain their ownership of the edtech startup over 50%. The round was led by ETS Global and Bodhi Tree and saw participation of Kaizen Management Advisors along with existing investors like International Finance Corporation and Temasek.

191.title: IMD issues orange alert for Mumbai, SEOC asks citizens to stay home
191.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued an orange alert in Mumbai as the city is expected to receive very heavy rainfall in the coming week. The State Emergency Operation Center (SEOC) has asked citizens not to leave their houses unless necessary and follow instructions from the local government administration. Mumbai will remain on orange alert from Monday till Wednesday.

192.title: BJP MLA, Mayor among 40 people accused of illegally selling plots in Ayodhya
192.article_body: Ayodhya Mayor Rishikesh Upadhyay and BJP MLA Ved Prakash Gupta are among 40 people accused of illegally selling plots and building infrastructure in the city. The mayor and the MLA have alleged foul play in the list of alleged offenders released by the Ayodhya Development Authority.  Former BJP MLA Gorakhnath Baba is also among the accused persons.

193.title: Woman dead after 19-yr-old driving Jaguar rams into her in Kolkata; CCTV video surfaces
193.article_body: A 45-year-old female pedestrian died allegedly after a 19-year-old driving a Jaguar car rammed into her in Kolkata. A CCTV footage of the incident has also surfaced online, which shows the speeding vehicle hitting her. The accused had hit two other cars before crashing into the woman, reports quoting eyewitnesses stated.

194.title: Father, sons kill Bihar man for stealing iron rods from shop in B'luru
194.article_body: A father-son duo has been arrested for allegedly killing a construction worker from Bihar for stealing iron rods from their shop in Bengaluru. After catching the victim red-handed, the accused hit him with iron rods and assaulted him, leading to his death. The father was later detained and confessed his second son was also involved in assaulting the victim.

195.title: 15-yr-old killed in cloudburst in Himachal Pradesh's Chamba; houses vacated
195.article_body: A 15-year-old boy was killed after cloudbursts struck at least two villages, Bhadoga and Kandhwara, in Himachal Pradesh's Chamba district. The Chamba District Emergency Operation Centre (DEOC) said that the villages were hit by sudden heavy rains in the intervening night of Sunday and Monday. Some houses were also vacated and people were shifted to safer places.

196.title: Delhi man kidnapped, assaulted for failing to repay ₹20 Lakh
196.article_body: A Delhi businessman was allegedly abducted and manhandled after he allegedly failed to repay a loan of ₹20 lakh, taken from a money lending firm, police said on Sunday. The victim claimed the accused barged into his office and assaulted him. He alleged the accused abducted him and later dropped him outside his office, said Amrutha Guguloth, DCP (New Delhi).

197.title: No hope left in SC, sensitive cases assigned to only certain judges: Sibal
197.article_body: Rajya Sabha MP and senior advocate Kapil Sibal criticised some of the recent judgements passed by the Supreme Court and said that "sensitive cases" are assigned to only selective judges adding that he has "no hope left" in the institution. "I am saying this after completing 50 years of practising in the Supreme Court," Sibal added.

198.title: NMMC forms 75 with vehicles to mark 75 years of India's independence
198.article_body: Different departments of the Navi Mumbai Municipal Corporation (NMMC) are forming the number 75 as part of the Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav campaign. Vehicles from NMMC's fleet were displayed at Belapur Jetty in the shape of number 75 to celebrate 75 years of the nation's independence. Earlier, Gujarat students made a human formation of the number 75.

199.title: PV Sindhu wins her first-ever CWG gold medal in singles
199.article_body: Two-time Olympic medal-winning shuttler PV Sindhu on Monday bagged her first-ever CWG gold medal in singles. The 27-year-old defeated Michelle Li of Canada 21-15, 21-13 in the women's singles final at CWG 2022 in Birmingham. It is Sindhu's third singles medal at CWG after her silver at 2018 Gold Coast Games and bronze at 2014 Glasgow Games.

200.title: Rajasthan can't stop crime against women: BJP leader after MP alleges attack
200.article_body: After BJP MP Ranjeeta Koli claimed she was attacked by mining mafia, BJP MP Jaskaur Meena said Rajasthan government cannot stop crime against women. The incident was reported from Bharatpur. "CM gives statements in interest of criminals," Meena added. "Our MP's life [is] under threat. I've given a Zero Hour notice…will take up this matter in the House," Meena stated.

201.title: Former Haitian senator killed by gangs amid a spike in violence
201.article_body: Amid a spike in violence in Haiti's capital city Port-au-Prince, the Caribbean country's PM Ariel Henry said on Sunday that former senator Yvon Buissereth was killed by gangs in the capital's Laboule area. Yvon was killed while police battled with gangs, reported Reuters. "[Yvon's] killers, as well as...all other criminals who sow mourning...will be fully prosecuted," Haitian PM Henry said.

202.title: Woman hit by goods train at B'luru station; given first aid, hospitalised
202.article_body: A woman was allegedly hit by a goods train at Bengaluru's Yelahanka Railway Station on Sunday. Staff from the Railway Protection Force (RPF) gave the injured woman first aid treatment and then shifted her to a hospital for further treatment. Reports said that it is not yet clear how the injury occurred.

203.title: She's so much like Ranbir in a sense: Alia Bhatt on Neetu Kapoor
203.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt, speaking about her mother-in-law Neetu Kapoor, has said that the veteran actress is "so much like" Ranbir Kapoor. "She is so supportive, she's so positive and at the same time, she really lets you be," Alia stated. "Even during my wedding, my friends were like 'Oh my god, your mother-in-law is...outstanding, she's so cool'," Alia added.

204.title: I sulk, cry, do things that normal humans do: Kriti on films failing
204.article_body: Speaking about her reaction to her films failing at box office, actress Kriti Sanon said that she sulks, cries and does things "normal human beings do". She added that she gets defensive about certain films because she is close to them. "But I have to move on...there's nothing more you can do as an actor beyond a point," Kriti said.

205.title: He is man of great humility: Seth on Letterman coming as 'Late Night' guest
205.article_body: Seth Meyers revealed that David Letterman was nervous when the latter returned to the 'Late Night' show as a guest. "He is forever a man of great humility...it's shocking to me that I was in a position to tell Letterman, 'Yeah, you're doing great. Don't worry, Letterman, you are on a talk show and you're doing great'," Seth stated.

206.title: Apple asks suppliers to avoid 'Made in Taiwan' labels on shipments to China: Report
206.article_body: Apple has reportedly asked its Taiwan-based suppliers to ensure shipments to China don't carry the label 'Made in Taiwan', in a bid to avoid disruptions from Chinese customs inspections after the visit of US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi to Taipei. The report stated that Apple asked manufacturers to label components as "Chinese Taipei" or "Taiwan, China".

207.title: Ashamed to say it's our govt: BJP MP video on Noida chaos tweeted by Congress
207.article_body: Congress shared a video of BJP MP Mahesh Sharma publicly expressing his anger over the chaos created by supporters of Shrikant Tyagi in Noida's housing society, where the woman who was abused and assaulted by Tyagi lives. In the video, Sharma can be heard saying, "We are ashamed to say that it's our government here...There can't be anything more shameful."

208.title: Wife, granddaughter of retired constable killed in Meerut; robbery suspected
208.article_body: The wife of a retired head constable and their 12-year-old granddaughter were killed by unknown person in Meerut's Shastri Nagar area on Sunday, police said. The matter came to light after the neighbours informed the police that the house remained closed since morning and nobody came out. It seems that they were killed during a robbery attempt, the police claimed.

209.title: ₹25,000 cash prize announced on arrest of Shrikant Tyagi who assaulted a woman in Noida
209.article_body: The Commissionerate of Gautam Buddha Nagar, Uttar Pradesh on Monday announced a cash prize of ₹25,000 to the person who helps with the arrest of politician Shrikant Tyagi, who is accused of assaulting a woman in a housing society in Noida. This comes after Noida administration demolished the illegal construction at Tyagi's residence earlier today.

210.title: Rajasthan at number one for rapes in India: BJP's Rajyavardhan Rathore
210.article_body: BJP leader Rajyavardhan Rathore on Monday said that people in Rajasthan are scared and CM Ashok Gehlot is giving new statements in defence of rapists. "Rajasthan [is at] number one for rapes in the country," Rathore added. Earlier, Gehlot had said, "Incidents of murder after rape have increased due to the law on the hanging of culprits after Nirbhaya case."

211.title: Bihar leader RCP Singh in touch with JD(U) MLAs amid tension with BJP: Report
211.article_body: After Bihar leader RCP Singh resigned from the Janta Dal (United), he is in touch with several party MLAs, reports said. Meanwhile, Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar has asked all MLAs of the Janata Dal (United) to be present in Patna by Monday evening. This comes amid speculations of 'split' between the Janata Dal (United) and the Bharatiya Janta Party.

212.title: Shooting takes place outside a bar in US' Cincinnati; 9 injured
212.article_body: At least nine people were injured in a shooting outside a bar in US' Cincinnati on Sunday, police said. A police officer fired one round at a suspect, who then fled the spot, a police official said. The police, however, believe that there were two shooters as more shots were fired after the first suspect fled, the police official added.

213.title: Katrina's 'Merry Christmas' shoot location changed days after fire at Chitrakoot
213.article_body: The location of Katrina Kaif-starrer 'Merry Christmas' has been changed to Vrindavan studio days after a fire gutted Chitrakoot studio leaving one dead. Director Luv Ranjan's untitled film starring Ranbir Kapoor and Shraddha Kapoor was being shot on the now-gutted set. 'Merry Christmas' producer Ramesh Taurani said that they have dismantled their film's set from Chitrakoot studio.

214.title: Shah Rukh is my favourite co-star, can't wait to work with him again: Alia
214.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt has stated that actor Shah Rukh Khan is her favourite co-star, adding that she cannot wait to get back on set with him again. The two shared screen space in 2016 film 'Dear Zindagi' and produced 2022 film 'Darlings' together. "Unfortunately, we...haven't been approached by the same filmmaker but I'm hopeful it'll happen soon," Alia added.

215.title: Pic of India men's team watching India women's CWG final vs Australia goes viral
215.article_body: A photo of India men's team watching India women's final against Australia in the Commonwealth Games' first-ever cricket event is going viral on social media. "Nail-biter at Edgbaston. Senior men's team following #TeamIndia's progress," the team had captioned the picture. India bagged silver medal while Australia won gold in the event.

216.title: Your one-liners are win-liners: PM Modi to outgoing Vice President Naidu
216.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Monday thanked outgoing Rajya Sabha Chairman and Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu at the conclusion of his tenure. PM Modi said, "This is a very emotional moment for this House." He added, "Your one-liners are wit-liners. They are win-liners too. It means nothing more needs to be said after those lines."

217.title: Amazon-iRobot deal might face anti-trust review by US FTC: Experts
217.article_body: Amazon's decision to move ahead with its acquisition of iRobot Corp for $1.7 billion is likely to face scrutiny from the US Federal Trade Commission (FTC), experts said. Amazon's $3.49 billion deal to buy 1Life Healthcare is already being probed. The FTC, under Chair Lina Khan, has been pushed to take a harder look at acquisitions by big tech firms.

218.title: Self-styled godman claiming to be reincarnation of goddess Kali absconding
218.article_body: A self-styled godman who claimed to be a reincarnation of goddess Kali is currently absconding from Uttar Pradesh, police stated on Monday. The accused, identified as Mukesh, claimed that he has supernatural powers to cure cancer and infertility among other diseases. Mukesh has cheated thousands of people and would organise healing darbars at night at a temple near Varanasi.

219.title: Nitish Kumar calls JD(U) MLAs to Patna amid reports of split with BJP
219.article_body: Amid speculation of 'split' with Bharatiya Janata Party, Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar has asked all MLAs of the Janata Dal (United) to be present in Patna by Monday evening. "Two conspiracies were hatched against Nitish Kumar in recent times...Chirag model of 2020...was responsible for bringing down our Assembly seats to 43," JD(U) National President Lalan Singh had earlier said.

220.title: We aren't targeting any community through 'Hum Do...': Director
220.article_body: 'Hum Do Hamare Baarah' director Kamal Chandra has said that the poster of the film is not objectionable at all. "We assure you that we aren't targeting any one particular community through our film," the director said. "Population explosion is a very serious issue that is bugging our country for a long time," he added. The film features Annu Kapoor.

221.title: Climate change making prediction difficult for weather agencies: IMD DG
221.article_body: Climate change has hampered the ability of forecasting agencies to accurately predict weather, India Meteorological Department (IMD) DG Mrutyunjay Mohapatra said. He further informed that IMD is installing more radars and upgrading its high-performance computing system to meet the challenge. The impact-based forecast will improve to become "more granular, specific and accurate" by 2025, he added.

222.title: 1 lakh tourists stranded in China's Hainan amid COVID-19 outbreak
222.article_body: Almost 1 lakh tourists are expected to remain stranded in China's Hainan for at least a week amid a coronavirus outbreak. This comes as China locked down more areas in Hainan on Monday, according to state media. "We just hope it won’t turn into another Shanghai," a tourist said referring to Shanghai's two-month lockdown, which was lifted in June.

223.title: Paytm shares gain 6% as Q1 net loss narrows to ₹644 crore
223.article_body: One97 Communications Ltd, Paytm's parent company, saw its shares surge nearly 6% on Monday. The development comes after it reported a net loss of ₹644.4 crore in the quarter that ended in June, as compared to net loss of ₹761.4 crore recorded in previous three months. Rise in subscription revenue, growth in bill payments helped narrow the loss, Paytm said.

224.title: We are the single largest party in Bihar: RJD MP Manoj Kumar Jha
224.article_body: MP Manoj Kumar Jha has stated that Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) is the single largest party in Bihar. He further said that RJD can't see elements of instability in the state, adding that Bihar will decide what is best for it. His statement comes amid reports of Janata Dal (United) talking about splitting up with the BJP in the state.

225.title: Rohit drives buggy on ground with teammates on it to celebrate series win, video viral
225.article_body: A video has gone viral showing Team India captain Rohit Sharma driving a buggy on the ground carrying his teammates to celebrate 4-1 T20I series win against West Indies has gone viral. In the video, spectators can be heard cheering for Team India while the players take a victory lap on the buggy. The final match took place in Florida.

226.title: WWII bomb found in dried-up Italian river detonated; video surfaces
226.article_body: Italian army on Sunday detonated a World War II bomb, which was found in dried-up River Po, in a controlled explosion on Sunday. A video of the incident has surfaced online. The bomb was found on the river bank by fishermen "due to...decrease in water levels caused by drought", a colonel said. About 3,000 people were evacuated, the army said.

227.title: Rubbish batting, no common sense: Azharuddin after India women win silver at CWG
227.article_body: After India bagged silver medal while Australia won gold in the first-ever women's cricket event at CWG, Mohammed Azharuddin tweeted, "Rubbish batting by the Indian team. No common sense. Gave away a winning game." Australia had posted a total of 161/8 in their 20 overs before dismissing India for 152 runs. India lost its last eight wickets for 34 runs.

228.title: I meant illegally hot: Seema Sajdeh on calling 'Liger' song 'nonsense'
228.article_body: 'Fabulous Lives of Bollywood Wives' star Seema Sajdeh has clarified why she called Ananya Panday's song from her upcoming film 'Liger' "nonsense" on Instagram after the actress posted the song. Ananya posted pictures from the shoot of the song 'Aafat'. To this, Seema commented, "What nonsense...that means illegally hot!" Ananya's mother Bhavana also featured in 'Fabulous Lives of Bollywood Wives'.

229.title: Parents held after 5-yr-old's death in Maha; videos of them beating her found
229.article_body: Three people including the father and the mother of a five-year-old girl have been arrested following the child's death. Police said that the parents had brought the child's body to a hospital in Maharashtra's Nagpur but had run away from there. "During the investigation, we found some videos...where the daughter was being beaten by them," police said.

230.title: 900-year-old China's longest wooden arch bridge collapses in fire, pic surfaces
230.article_body: A 900-year-old wooden arch bridge known as the Wan'an bridge in East China's Fujian caught fire on Saturday night and collapsed. The Wan'an bridge, also known as the Bridge of Universal Peace, was China's longest wooden arch bridge ranging 98.2 metres. The Wan'an bridge was on the preliminary list of China's World Cultural Heritage sites in 2012.

231.title: Govt shouldn’t force policies on state govts: Mamata at NITI Aayog meet
231.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Sunday said the Centre should look into the demands of state governments "more seriously" and no policies should be forced on them. While addressing a meeting of the Governing Council of the NITI Aayog in New Delhi, Banerjee stated that there should be greater cooperation between the Centre and state governments, according to reports.

232.title: Won't let accused walk free: UP Deputy CM after politician abused woman in Noida
232.article_body: After Shrikant Tyagi, who identifies himself on social media as national executive member of BJP's Kisan Morcha, abused and assaulted a woman in Noida, UP Deputy CM Brajesh Pathak said CM Yogi Adityanath has taken cognisance of the whole case. "We'll not let the accused walk free. Strict action will be taken against those who break the law," Pathak added.

233.title: 7-yr-old girl eats chocolate with wrapper, dies of cardiac arrest in K'taka
233.article_body: A 7-year-old girl, who passed away after eating a chocolate without removing its wrapper, suffered a cardiac arrest and did not choke to death, police said. The girl was waiting to board her school bus on July 20 when she collapsed and died. The victim's family members underwent medical tests showing that they have a genetic heart-related problem, police stated.

234.title: Reliance Chairman Mukesh Ambani draws NIL salary for 2nd year in a row
234.article_body: Reliance Industries' Chairman Mukesh Ambani drew no salary for the second year in a row in 2021-22. The 65-year-old had voluntarily given up remuneration during the last fiscal in light of the COVID-19 pandemic. Ambani is the second richest person in Asia with a $90.5 billion fortune, per Bloomberg. Previously, his salary had been capped at ₹15 crore since 2008-09.

235.title: 'Mahabharat' will never let you down, you might let it down: Aamir Khan
235.article_body: Aamir Khan, speaking about 'Mahabharat', has said, "When you're making 'Mahabharat', you're not making a film, you're doing a yagna." Aamir stated 'Mahabharat' isn't a movie and it's much deeper. "So I'm not ready for that. I'm afraid to bring it out in the fore. 'Mahabharat' will never let you down, you might let it down," he added.

236.title: 73 families affected in Mumbai's Malad mishap get new homes
236.article_body: Seventy-three families, who got affected by the Malad building collapse incident in 2019, received possession of new homes after three years. The building collapse incident, which occurred in 2019 at Ambedkar Nagar in the Pimpripada area, killed several people. Out of the 156 affected families, BMC had already shifted 83 families in new homes before shifting the remaining 73 families.

237.title: Youth stabs friend in Bengaluru for refusing to buy him beer
237.article_body: A 23-year-old youth allegedly stabbed his friend for refusing to buy him a beer in Bengaluru and is currently absconding. The suspect and victim are close friends and do odd jobs. The victim had bought three beers and refused to purchase more saying he didn't have money, police said. The victim sustained a stab injury on his left thigh.

238.title: Aim to have 220 airports by 2030, 40 cr air travellers by 2027: Union Minister
238.article_body: Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia said the country’s civil aviation sector is set to see a phenomenal growth in terms of passengers, airports and aircraft, with the number of air travellers projected to touch 40 crore by 2027. "We intend to go to 220 airports by 2030," Scindia added. India is looking at close to 1,200 aircraft by 2027, Scindia stated.

239.title: Shivon has an IQ of 170, Elon on right track: Musk's father as Elon has kids with exec
239.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk’s father Errol in an interview commented, “Shivon has an IQ of about 170, Elon is on a right track there.” Recently, it was reported that Elon fathered two children last year with Shivon Zilis, a top executive at his artificial intelligence company Neuralink. Errol added that he and his son are attracted to intelligent women.

240.title: Men posing as police thrash, kill driver for refusal to pay fine in West Bengal
240.article_body: Two men posing as police personnel thrashed and killed a man driving a goods truck in West Bengal over refusal to pay a ₹5,000 fine. The accused had a fake police sticker on their bike. One of the victim's friends called police after which the accused were arrested. The victim was rushed to the hospital but succumbed to his injuries.

241.title: BJP MP alleges attack by mining mafia in Bharatpur, says 'I could've been killed'
241.article_body: Bharatiya Janata Party MP Ranjeeta Koli claimed she was attacked by mining mafia. The incident was reported from Rajasthan's Bharatpur. "I saw about 150 trucks that were overloaded. I tried to stop them but they [ran away]...they pelted stones. I could have been killed," Koli said. Following the incident, she went on a sit-in protest alleging lack of police action.

242.title: 18-yr-old man's body gets stuck in engine of train, gets dragged for 5km in UP
242.article_body: An 18-year-old man's body got stuck in the engine of a goods train and was dragged for around 5 kilometres on the Delhi-Howrah rail line on Sunday, officials said. On getting information about the body, the driver of the goods train stopped it near Sirathu railway station in Uttar Pradesh. The body was sent for post-mortem, officials added.

243.title: UK museum to return Benin Bronzes looted in 19th century to Nigeria
243.article_body: Horniman Museum and Gardens in UK's London on Sunday agreed to return a collection of Benin Bronzes to Nigeria. The artefacts were looted when the British military attacked Benin City in the 19th century. This comes after the museum received a formal request from Nigeria's National Commission for Museums and Monuments for the return of the artefacts earlier this year.

244.title: Musk's father denies saying he's 'not proud of him', says 'I love Elon'
244.article_body: Clarifying his remarks made during an interview on Australian radio, Tesla CEO Elon Musk's father Errol said that he didn’t say he was not proud of his son. Errol said that he had misinterpreted the question and said, "I'm very thankful for Elon's achievements…I love Elon." Elon reportedly texted his father to “please keep quiet” after his earlier remarks.

245.title: Raj CM announces ex-gratia of ₹5 lakh for families of those killed in temple stampede
245.article_body: Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot has announced ex-gratia of ₹5 lakh each for families of those who lost their lives in the stampede that took place at Khatu Shyamji Temple in Rajasthan's Sikar on Monday morning. Three people were killed in the incident. The Chief Minister has also announced an aid of ₹20,000 each for those injured in the stampede.

246.title: 90-yr-old man declared dead on paper, files complaint to prove he's alive in UP
246.article_body: A 90-year-old man named Krishnanand Saraswati has filed a complaint with a municipal commissioner to prove he's alive after Uttar Pradesh's Firozabad Municipal Corporation issued his death certificate last year. He alleged that a local land mafia connived with the municipal corporation and managed to get his death certificate to take over a temple land managed by him.

247.title: UP school headmaster asks students to get ₹15 for I-Day, suspended
247.article_body: Headmaster of a government primary school in Uttar Pradesh's Hathras district was suspended for allegedly demanding money from the students for buying national flags for Independence Day celebrations. The headmaster asked students to bring ₹15 each for celebrations. He told students that the money was being demanded as per the order issued by the state government and the chief minister.

248.title: Final scores for JEE (Main) 2022 for BE/BTech declared, 24 candidates get perfect 100
248.article_body: The National Testing Agency on Monday declared the final NTA scores for JEE (Main) 2022 for Paper 1 (BE/BTech). A list of 24 candidates who scored a perfect 100 was also released. The candidates can check and download the result on the official websites jeemain.nta.nic.in and ntaresults.nic.in. JEE (Main) 2022 scorecard is available to download on jeemain.nta.nic.in.

249.title: If a film has to do well, it'll do well regardless of its cast: Ektaa
249.article_body: Producer Ektaa Kapoor, speaking about female-oriented films, has said, "If a film has to do well, it will do well at the box office regardless of its cast." "'Gangubai Kathiawadi' was a female-driven film which did well at the box office...There were male actors who weren't popular and yet their films did well and vice versa," she added.

250.title: Have all legal documents to prove WazirX owned by Binance: Co-founder Shetty
250.article_body: WazirX Co-founder Nischal Shetty said he has all legal documents that prove that Binance controls the cryptocurrency operations on the platform. After the Enforcement Directorate froze WazirX’s assets worth almost ₹65 crore for alleged money laundering, Binance CEO denied owning the platform saying the transaction was never completed while Shetty argued WazirX was acquired by Binance in 2019.

251.title: As a celebrity, hate gets multiplied by thousands: Jacqueline
251.article_body: Actress Jacqueline Fernandez has reacted to negative media reports and online hatred after she was summoned by ED over a money laundering case involving Sukesh Chandrasekhar. "As a celebrity...when somebody doesn't like you, it gets multiplied by thousands," she said. She added, "The hardest part is...accepting...in this work, you'll have to face...that not everyone is going to like you."

252.title: Bengaluru Police busts seven more cases of vehicle theft
252.article_body: The Bengaluru Police arrested more thieves on Sunday, busting seven more cases of vehicle theft in the city. Bengaluru DCP Laxman B Nimbargi said that the accused have been arrested by Bengaluru's Jnanabharathi Police. He added that six two-wheelers and a goods truck used for the crime have been recovered from the accused in the case.

253.title: Process of globalisation appears to have hit a wall: Mukesh Ambani
253.article_body: Reliance Industries' Chairman Mukesh Ambani, in a letter to shareholders, wrote, "The process of globalisation, which drove the global economic growth over the last four decades, appears to have hit a wall." He said that geopolitical tensions have exposed fault lines in global economy. "The cause of economic inter-dependence that globalisation promoted...has taken a back seat," Ambani added.

254.title: 15-yr-old girl shot dead by 9-yr-old boy playing with gun in US
254.article_body: A 15-year-old girl was killed in Baltimore in US' Maryland after a nine-year-old boy accidentally shot her in the head while playing with a loaded gun, police said on Sunday. According to a news report, the police added that the boy would not be criminally charged due to his age and that the gun was registered to his relative.

255.title: Baidu secures licences for China's first fully driverless robotaxi
255.article_body: China's search engine giant Baidu said it has obtained permits to operate fully driverless robotaxis on open roads in the cities of Wuhan and Chongqing. The permits, which come into effect on Monday, allow Baidu to offer robotaxi services without safety drivers. The firm is in talks with Beijing, Shanghai and Shenzhen authorities for licences to test fully driverless robotaxis.

256.title: Illegal construction at residence of politician who abused woman in Noida demolished
256.article_body: Noida administration, on Monday, demolished illegal construction at the residence of Shrikant Tyagi in Grand Omaxe in Noida's Sector 93. Tyagi, who identifies himself on social media as national executive member of BJP's Kisan Morcha, had abused and assaulted a woman. The woman had objected to plantation of some trees by Tyagi, which had led to argument between the two.

257.title: I never looked at 'Thappad', 'Dobaaraa' as Taapsee's films: Pavail
257.article_body: Actor Pavail Gulati stated that he never looked at his films 'Thappad' and 'Dobaaraa' as being Taapsee Pannu-led films. "'Thappad' has given me so much, however, I want to be the face of the film," he added. Pavail further said he wants to work with good directors, adding he will blindly do a one-scene role in an Anurag Kashyap film.

258.title: TMC leader to skip CBI summons in cattle smuggling case
258.article_body: TMC Birbhum district President Anubrata Mondal is likely to skip CBI summons in connection with the cattle smuggling scam today, reports said. He was called for questioning after his earlier statements were not matching with the evidence obtained by the CBI. Mondal's close aide has claimed that he will not be present for questioning because of a scheduled health check-up.

259.title: China skips US talks, says US must face 'serious consequences'
259.article_body: China's defence ministry on Monday defended its decision to not proceed with military talks with the United States as a sign of protest against US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's visit to Taiwan last week. Beijing has warned that Washington must bear "serious consequences". Pelosi's visit to Taiwan infuriated China as it considers the island nation as its own territory.

260.title: India reports 16,167 new COVID-19 cases in 24 hours, positivity rate at 6.14%
260.article_body: India has reported 16,167 new COVID-19 cases and 41 deaths in the last 24 hours, including 15 reconciled deaths in Kerala, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. India's active caseload stood at 1,35,510, while the daily positivity rate stood at 6.14%. The COVID-19 death toll in the country reached 5,26,730.

261.title: I am no model, I do positive politics: Chirag Paswan to JD(U)
261.article_body: Lok Janshakti Party (LJP) chief Chirag Paswan criticised JD(U) leader Rajiv Ranjan Singh for saying "another Chirag model was being hatched but Nitish Kumar diffused it in time" in reference to RCP Singh. "I do positive politics. I am no model. There has been a split in house of the one who broke the house of another," Chirag tweeted.

262.title: Punjab, Assam discuss farm issues at NITI Aayog meet
262.article_body: The Chief Ministers of several states discussed many issues in the 7th NITI Aayog meet that was chaired by PM Modi on Sunday. Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann raised issues of farmers including Minimum Support Price (MSP). Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma discussed the modernisation of the agriculture sector to help farmers. Meanwhile, Uttarakhand focused on online education and virtual classrooms.

263.title: SRK gets angry as fan tries to hold hand at airport; video shows Aryan calming him down
263.article_body: A video showing Shah Rukh Khan getting angry after a fan tried to hold his hand while clicking a selfie at Mumbai airport is going viral on social media. Aryan Khan can be seen instantly stepping in calming SRK down. The actor was coming out of the airport with his sons Aryan and AbRam.

264.title: Russia shelled Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant again, 1 injured: Ukraine
264.article_body: Ukraine on Sunday accused Russia of shelling Europe's largest nuclear facility, Zaporizhzhia plant, again. The Russian rocket attacks had damaged three radiation monitoring detectors and injured one worker, the country's state nuclear firm claimed. Following this, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy tweeted that "Russian nuclear terror" needs a "stronger response" from international community.

265.title: Apple to manufacture iPhone 14 in India at same time as China: Reports
265.article_body: Apple is likely to launch iPhone 14 in September this year and the phone will reportedly be manufactured in India simultaneously with China. Apple started manufacturing iPhones in India in 2017 with iPhone SE and currently manufactures iPhone 11, iPhone 12, and iPhone 13 in the country. Apple's production in India is reportedly a quarter less than China's.

266.title: Nitish Kumar identified those who tried to damage JD(U): Party chief
266.article_body: JD(U) National President Rajiv Ranjan Singh on Sunday said that Bihar CM Nitish Kumar identified those who were trying to damage the party and took steps to mend it. His statement came after RCP Singh resigned from the party after it sought an explanation from him over corruption allegations. "JD(U) isn't a sinking ship, it's a sailing ship," Rajiv added.

267.title: As theft cases rise, Delhi police to block stolen phones via IMEI number
267.article_body: Following the increase in theft and robbery cases in national capital, Delhi Police has decided to team up with internet service providers and the department of telecommunications to block the stolen phones using International Mobile Equipment Identity (IMEI) number. "[We will]  register data of all stolen phones and upload it on Crime and Criminal Tracking Network and Systems," official said.

268.title: Truck hits Samajwadi Party leader's car, drags it for 500 metres in UP's Mainpuri
268.article_body: A truck hit Samajwadi Party leader Devendra Singh Yadav's car in Uttar Pradesh's Mainpuri on Sunday. News agency ANI said that the truck also dragged his car for around 500 metres. The incident took place near Bhadawar House in Mainpuri Sadar Kotwali area when the SP District President was on his way to his residence via Karhal Road.

269.title: Billionaire charged in largest tax evasion case against individual in US dies at 81
269.article_body: Billionaire Robert Brockman, who was charged in the largest-ever tax evasion case against an individual in the US, has passed away aged 81. Brockman was a software entrepreneur and was suffering from dementia. In 2020, the US government had charged Brockman with 39 counts of tax evasion, wire fraud, and money laundering for concealing about $2 billion in income.

270.title: Politician's supporters enter Noida housing society, ask for address of woman he abused
270.article_body: A ruckus broke in a housing society in Noida on Sunday night when a group of supporters of politician Shrikant Tyagi forcibly entered the society. This comes days after Tyagi abused and pushed a woman on camera. Tyagi's supporters asked for the woman's address and raised slogans in his support. Seven people were detained in the case on Sunday.

271.title: Indian DOTA 2 Esports team bags bronze at Commonwealth Esports Championships
271.article_body: The Indian DOTA 2 Esports team on Sunday bagged the bronze medal in the Commonwealth Esports Championships. The Indian team comprising Moin Ejaz, Ketan Goyal, Abhishek Yadav, Shubham Goli and Vishal Vernekar defeated New Zealand 2-0 in the bronze decider. The Indian team had lost to Malaysia in the semi-finals.

272.title: My parents are now assured I won't die of hunger: Vijay Varma
272.article_body: Actor Vijay Varma has said his parents do not have "much regard" for his success in the film industry. "My mom is a very normal homely woman...Yes, they are now assured that I won't die because of hunger and I can earn my living comfortably," he added. Recently, Vijay featured in the film 'Darlings', which also starred actress Alia Bhatt.

273.title: It's for us citizens to transform Constitution: Justice Chandrachud
273.article_body: Our constitutional culture doesn't maintain itself and it's for the citizens to transform the Constitution, Supreme Court judge Justice DY Chandrachud said. "It's for each one of us citizens to participate in slow but vital task everyday of transforming our Constitution from a charter of ideals to a reflection of reality," he said during a university's convocation ceremony on Sunday.

274.title: Who were India's medallists on second-last day of CWG 2022 as country bagged 15 medals?
274.article_body: Sharath Kamal/Sreeja Akula (TT), Eldhose Paul (triple jump), boxers Nitu Ghanghas, Amit Panghal & Nikhat Zareen won gold. Abdulla Aboobacker (triple jump), Sagar (boxing) & Sharath/Sathiyan (TT) bagged silver. Annu Rani (javelin throw), Sandeep Kumar (10km race walk), Dipika Pallikal/Saurav Ghosal (squash), Kidambi Srikanth (badminton) & Treesa Jolly/Gayatri Gopichand (badminton) won bronze.

275.title: Reviewer harassing me for 6yrs, even when mom was recovering from cancer: Nithya
275.article_body: Actress Nithya Menen has revealed that a viral film reviewer has been harassing her for over six years, including calling up her and her parents while her mother was recovering from cancer. She added that she had to block almost 30 of his phone numbers. "I have shown incredible patience despite everyone asking me to file police complaint," Nithya stated.

276.title: Tata Motors to buy Ford's manufacturing plant in Gujarat for ₹726 crore
276.article_body: Tata Motors on Sunday announced that it has signed an agreement to buy Ford Motor's manufacturing plant in Sanand, Gujarat for ₹726 crore. The agreement between the two companies includes land, assets and transfer of all eligible employees. The development comes nearly a year after Ford Motor said it will cease local manufacturing in India due to operating losses.

277.title: Delhi Police busts interstate gang stealing, reselling phones with altered settings
277.article_body: Delhi Police has busted an interstate gang after arresting two individuals for allegedly stealing and reselling phones after altering their IMEI numbers. Police recovered 66 such phones along with a laptop which ran the software for alterations. The main accused, identified as a Dehradun-based engineer, has been running the gang for at least three years and is currently absconding.

278.title: Bombay HC refuses to allow abortion of mentally challenged rape survivor
278.article_body: The Bombay High Court has refused to allow a mentally challenged rape survivor to terminate her 35-week (8.5 months) pregnancy after a board of medical experts said that it was a high risk to her maternal health. The High Court further said that if the child is born alive, the state should take care of the child.

279.title: Nitish works for 3 hrs, enjoys rest of day with 3-4 ministers: RCP Singh
279.article_body: RCP Singh, former principal secretary to Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar, said that Kumar works for three hours and not 18 hours everyday. "[He] enjoys the remaining day with three to four selected leaders," Singh added. Singh recently quit the Janata Dal (United) after he was asked for an explanation for corruption charges against him.

280.title: Hyd Police shares list of routes to avoid tomorrow for Muharram procession
280.article_body: The Hyderabad Traffic Police issued notification imposing traffic restrictions in Dabeerpura, Chaderghat and Yakutpura areas in the view of Bibi-Ka-Alam Muharram procession tomorrow. The restrictions will be in effect from 12 noon to 10 pm. Vehicular movement will not be allowed towards Bada Bazar and it will be diverted at Etebar Chowk towards either Kotla Alija or Purani Haveli's side.

281.title: 2-foot touch, reminder about seat belt now allowed in Delhi driving test
281.article_body: Delhi government has decided to ease some rules for driving test in the national capital.  The 'two-foot' touch in which two-wheeler rider touches ground with both feet will be allowed. Further, touching the yellow line during the '8' formation will not lead to a candidate failing the test. The officials will also remind candidates to put on the seat belt.

282.title: German hotel chain offers to pay up to ₹40,000 for staff's tattoos, haircuts
282.article_body: A German hotel group, Ruby Hotels, is offering new recruits up to €500 (around ₹40,000) to get a new tattoo, piercing or haircut once they complete six months of employment. While the group launched the scheme in June, Ruby Hotels has seen a 25% jump in its job applications. The hotel group has 16 properties across Europe.

283.title: I only said truth: Gehlot amid criticism over his rape law remark
283.article_body: Following criticism over his rape law remark, Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said, "I only said the truth." "Whenever a rapist rapes a child, they then kill them for fear of being identified…So many deaths have never happened before," he added. Gehlot had said, "Incidents of murder after rape have increased due to law on hanging of culprits after Nirbhaya case."

284.title: India to fight for 5 gold medals on last day of CWG 2022 today; schedule out
284.article_body: India are in contention to win five gold medals on last day of CWG 2022 today. Shuttlers PV Sindhu and Lakshya Sen's respective singles finals will begin at 1.20 pm and 2.10 pm. Satwiskrairaj Rankireddy and Chirag Shetty's badminton men's doubles final will start at 3 pm. India's men's hockey gold medal match against Australia will begin at 5 pm.

285.title: Pakistani javelin thrower Arshad breaches 90-metre mark for 1st time, wins gold at CWG
285.article_body: Pakistani javelin thrower Arshad Nadeem breached the 90-metre mark for the first time and bagged gold medal in the men's javelin throw at CWG 2022. The 25-year-old, whose personal best throw was 86.38 metres ahead of the final, registered a best throw of 90.18 metres in his fifth attempt to win the gold. He also set a Commonwealth Games record.

286.title: How does the CWG 2022 medal tally read ahead of the final day?
286.article_body: India bagged a total of 15 medals on the penultimate day of CWG 2022, including five gold, four silver and six bronze medals. India have won a total of 55 medals and are placed fifth on the medal standings. New Zealand, who have won one more gold medal than India, are placed fourth on the medal standings.

287.title: India create history as spinners take all 10 wickets in a men's T20I for 1st time ever
287.article_body: Team India spinners took all 10 wickets against West Indies in the fifth T20I on Sunday, marking the first instance of a team's spinners taking all 10 wickets in a men's T20I innings. Ravi Bishnoi took four wickets, while Axar Patel and Kuldeep Yadav picked up three wickets each. Their combined figures in the match read 9.4-2-43-10.

288.title: Govt agencies start applying for license to sell liquor across Delhi
288.article_body: State-run agencies have started applying for L-6 licenses to open retail stores by September 1 following the rollback of Delhi government's November 2021 excise policy. L-6 is a license given to a retail store run by a government corporation in Delhi. The Delhi government is reportedly likely to set up and operate 500 liquor vends from September 1.

289.title: 3 dead, several injured in stampede at Khatu Shyamji Temple in Rajasthan's Sikar
289.article_body: Three people have died and several have been injured in a stampede at Khatu Shyamji Temple in Rajasthan's Sikar on Monday morning, news agency ANI reported. Two injured people were referred to a hospital in Jaipur, added ANI. According to reports, the stampede at Khatu Shyamji Temple occurred during a monthly fair.

290.title: 5 golgappas for 'Laal Singh Chaddha', loved the film: Ashutosh Gowariker
290.article_body: Taking to Twitter, filmmaker Ashutosh Gowariker said that he "loved" Aamir Khan and Kareena Kapoor-starrer 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. "Five sta...no...five golgappas for 'Laal Singh Chaddha'!! Loved the film and Aamir and Kareena's performances, Atul Kulkarni's script adaptation, and Advait Chandan's direction," Ashutosh tweeted. He further congratulated the cast and crew for creating a "noble film".

291.title: US Navy ship arrives at Indian shipyard for the 1st time for repairs
291.article_body: US Navy ship Charles Drew docked at Larsen & Toubro's shipyard in Chennai on Sunday for undertaking repairs, making it the first ever repair of a US Navy ship in India. The Defence Ministry called it a "huge boost" to 'Make in India'. The US was already using Indo-Pacific bases at Diego Garcia and Singapore for maintenance and ship repair.

292.title: India win gold medal in TT mixed doubles for the first time in CWG history
292.article_body: The Indian duo of Sharath Kamal Achanta and Sreeja Akula defeated the Malaysian duo of Javen Choong and Karen Lyne in the final to bag India's first-ever table tennis mixed doubles gold at CWG. With this, Sharath Kamal bagged his third medal at CWG 2022 after winning gold in men's team event and a silver medal in men's doubles event.

293.title: India win silver, Australia gold in first-ever women's cricket event at CWG
293.article_body: India bagged silver medal while Australia won gold in the first-ever women's cricket event at CWG. Australia defeated India by nine runs in the final. Australia posted a total of 161/8 in their 20 overs before dismissing India for 152 runs in 19.3 overs. India captain Harmanpreet top-scored in the final with 65(43).

294.title: Indian shuttler Kidambi Srikanth wins singles bronze at CWG 2022, his 4th CWG medal
294.article_body: Indian shuttler Kidambi Srikanth defeated Singapore's Jason Teh 21-15, 21-18 in the men's singles bronze medal match at CWG 2022 to bag his fourth medal in CWG history. Earlier, Srikanth had bagged mixed team silver at the ongoing Games. He had bagged mixed team gold and men's singles silver at the CWG 2018 in Gold Coast.

295.title: India beat West Indies for 13th time in 15 T20I matches, win series 4-1
295.article_body: India defeated West Indies by 88 runs in the fifth T20I in Florida to win the five-match series 4-1. This is India's 13th victory against West Indies in the last 15 T20I matches between the two teams. Further, this is the second time that India have won at least four matches in a five-match T20I series.

296.title: India's medal tally at CWG 2022 reaches 50 as Dipika-Saurav bag bronze in squash
296.article_body: India's medal tally at CWG 2022 reached 50 after Indian squash players Dipika Pallikal and Saurav Ghosal bagged bronze medal in mixed doubles event by defeating Australia's Donna Lobban and Cameron Pilley. The duo had bagged silver medal in the event at CWG 2018. India have bagged 17 gold, 13 silver and 20 bronze medals at CWG 2022 so far.

297.title: 40-year-old Sharath Kamal reaches men's singles table tennis gold medal match at CWG 2022
297.article_body: India's 40-year-old table tennis player Sharath Kamal Achanta has reached the men's singles gold medal match at CWG 2022. Sharath defeated England's Paul Drinkhall 11-8, 11-8, 8-11, 11-7, 9-11, 11-8 in the semi-final. He will face either compatriot Sathiyan Gnanasekaran or England's Liam Pitchford in the final on Monday.

298.title: China's largest-ever military drills around Taiwan expected to end
298.article_body: China's largest ever military drills surrounding Taiwan are expected to end following US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's visit to the island last week. Taiwan said six of the seven "temporary danger zones" China warned airlines to avoid ceased to be in effect from Sunday noon. China had deployed fighter jets, warships and ballistic missiles around Taiwan after Pelosi's trip.

299.title: Rohit has made it clear that India will carry ultra-attacking approach: Saba
299.article_body: Former India cricketer Saba Karim said that captain Rohit Sharma has made it clear that the team will continue their "ultra-attacking approach" in the T20 format. "We saw how it (strike rate) affected India in last year's T20 World Cup. But now...batting order has been set in a way that they need to carry on the attacking approach," Saba said.

300.title: Centre should review the cut in kerosene quota for fishermen: Kerala CM
300.article_body: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan has said that the Centre should review the cut in kerosene quota for fishermen. Speaking at NITI Aayog meet, Vijayan said that heavy rainfall has accelerated soil erosion in Kerala and the state needs assistance from the Centre for strengthening the coastal conservation steps. He added that the Centre needs to address challenges of cooperative federalism.

301.title: 12-year-old boy found murdered, dumped in gutter in Punjab
301.article_body: A 12-year-old boy was found murdered with his body dumped inside a gutter in the Samrala town of Ludhiana district in Punjab. The deceased, Harsh, had grievous injuries on his face while his mouth was tied with a piece of cloth, police said. Notably, Harsh's father Sunil Kumar told the police that his son had been missing for three days.

302.title: 'Rare' objects emitting radio waves found in distant galaxy cluster: Scientists
302.article_body: A series of 'rarely observed' radio wave-emitting objects have been spotted by scientists in the middle of a galaxy cluster located 800 million light-years away from us, scientists have said. The objects include "a fossil radio emission, a radio relic and a radio halo" within the galaxy cluster Abell 3266. The objects "defy existing theories" about their origins, scientists said.

303.title: She is India's pride: PM Modi on world champion Nikhat's maiden CWG gold
303.article_body: Following boxing world champion Nikhat Zareen's maiden gold medal at CWG, PM Narendra Modi said, "Nikhat is India's pride. She's a world class athlete who is admired for her skills." He tweeted, "I congratulate her on winning a gold medal at...CWG. Excelling in various tournaments, she has shown great consistency." Nikhat won in women's over 48kg-50kg (light fly) category final.

304.title: I will take PM Modi's autograph on my boxing gloves: CWG gold medallist Nikhat Zareen
304.article_body: After bagging a gold medal at CWG 2022, Indian boxer Nikhat Zareen said, "I am very excited to meet PM Narendra Modi." She further said, "I took a selfie with him last time and want a new one now. Last time, I took his autograph on my T-shirt, now I'll take it on my boxing gloves."

305.title: Israel agrees to Egypt-brokered truce amid ongoing Gaza conflict
305.article_body: Israel has agreed to observe a truce with Palestinian militants in Gaza as proposed by Egypt, according to sources. The Islamic Jihad, which is fighting in Gaza, said that talks for a ceasefire were still underway. Since Friday, Israel has carried out heavy aerial and artillery bombardment in Gaza, which reportedly killed 31 people and injured at least 270 others.

306.title: A film that stirs you from within: Nagarjuna on Aamir's Laal Singh Chaddha
306.article_body: Actor Nagarjuna Akkineni has penned a note praising Aamir Khan's upcoming film 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. Nagarjuna, who watched the film at a special screening, wrote, "A breath of fresh air! A film that goes more than surface deep. A film that stirs you from within!! Makes you laugh, cry and ponder!! It comes with...simple message, love and innocence conquer all."

307.title: We knew not to return back empty-handed: Savita on women's hockey CWG bronze
307.article_body: After Indian women's hockey team's bronze medal win at CWG 2022, captain Savita Punia said her side knew they had to recover from the time error in semi-final and not return back empty-handed from the bronze medal match against New Zealand. "Was difficult when timer stopped in our match with Australia. We lost morale and momentum," she added.

308.title: Island with 5-bedroom home & helipad put on sale for ₹3.3 crore in Scotland
308.article_body: A remote 28-acre island in Scotland that has a lighthouse, a five-bedroom accommodation and a helipad has been put on sale for £3,50,000 (around ₹3.3 crore), which is less than the average price of a London flat. The teardrop-shaped Pladda Isle is only accessible by boat or helicopter. It also has a 2.5-acre garden and stone jetty for boat transportation.

309.title: Ever saw such message from Pak PM: Pak journalist on PM Modi consoling wrestler Gehlot
309.article_body: Reacting to PM Narendra Modi's message consoling CWG 2022 bronze medal-winning wrestler Pooja Gehlot who apologised to the countrymen for not winning gold, Pakistani journalist Shiraz Hassan tweeted, "This is how India projects their athletes." He added, "Ever saw such message for Pakistan PM or President? Do they even know that Pakistani athletes are winning medals?"

310.title: 4th Muslim man murdered in US' Albuquerque in 'targeted killings'
310.article_body: A man who was murdered in US' Albuquerque on Friday, happens to be the fourth Muslim victim in a string of "targeted killings", according to state governor Michelle Lujan Grisham. The victim, whose name wasn't disclosed, was reportedly shot dead like the previous three victims, police said. New Mexico State Police and federal agencies are probing the murders.

311.title: Really looking forward to Hrithik and Saif's 'Vikram Vedha': Arjun
311.article_body: Actor Arjun Kapoor has said he's really looking forward to Saif Ali Khan and Hrithik Roshan-starrer 'Vikram Vedha', adding, "The ensemble feeling is exciting." Arjun, who has been part of two-hero films like 'Bhoot Police' and 'Ek Villain Returns', further said the industry is suffering because actors are "not coming together, collaborating and making it slightly better".

312.title: Bumrah, Bhuvneshwar are certainties for T20 WC; Shami might get nod too: Ravi
312.article_body: Former India coach Ravi Shastri has said that it is certain that pacers Bhuvneshwar Kumar and Jasprit Bumrah will feature in the squad for the upcoming T20 World Cup. "I feel [Mohammad] Shami will also get the nod," Shastri added. Coach Rajkumar Sharma has said, "I don't think Shami can be written off so easily...He is a proven world-class bowler."

313.title: My sex life isn't interesting enough to be invited to 'Koffee...', jokes Taapsee
313.article_body: Actress Taapsee Pannu, during the promotional event for her upcoming film 'Dobaaraa', took a dig at Karan Johar's talk show 'Koffee With Karan'. One of the journalists asked the actress why she isn't invited to Karan's show, to which she jokingly replied, "My sex life is not interesting enough to be invited to Koffee With Karan."

314.title: Ukraine probing almost 26,000 suspected war crime cases: Prosecutor
314.article_body: Ukraine is probing almost 26,000 suspected war crime cases committed since the Russian invasion began, Ukraine's chief war crimes prosecutor Yuriy Bilousov said. Ukraine has charged 135 people so far, of whom around 15 are currently in custody, Bilousov added. In May, a 21-year-old Russian soldier became the first person to be convicted in a war crimes trial in Ukraine.

315.title: Mohanlal visits India's 1st indigenous aircraft carrier Vikrant, shares pics
315.article_body: Actor Mohanlal, who holds the honorary rank of Lieutenant Colonel in the Indian Army, recently visited India's first indigenous aircraft carrier Vikrant. Calling it a "true engineering marvel", Mohanlal wrote on Instagram, "Witnessing the unmatched peculiarities of this mean machine urges me to triumphantly salute all the people behind IAC Vikrant, the wonder. May she always be victorious at sea!"

316.title: Partha Chatterjee won't resign from his MLA post: Lawyer
316.article_body: Suspended TMC leader Partha Chatterjee, who has been arrested in connection with the School Service Commission appointments scam case, doesn't want to resign from his MLA post, said his lawyer. "He (Partha) also mentioned that he is with his party and has full faith in TMC," the lawyer added. Meanwhile, a diabetic diet is being served to Chatterjee in jail.

317.title: Was getting goosebumps as National Anthem played: Panghal on his 1st CWG gold
317.article_body: After winning his maiden gold medal at Commonwealth Games on Sunday, Indian boxer Amit Panghal said he will try his best to win a gold in Olympics too. "I was getting goosebumps as National Anthem played, I'd like to feel like this again, would do anything for it," he added. Panghal won gold in men's over 48kg-51kg (flyweight) category final.

318.title: 295 turtles being smuggled to make aphrodisiacs recovered in UP
318.article_body: The Special Task Force of UP Police on Sunday recovered 295 freshwater turtles being smuggled to make aphrodisiacs, officials said. The STF also arrested a person who is allegedly a member of a gang involved in the smuggling of protected animals. The accused informed the police that the smuggled animals were to be used as food or as pets.

319.title: Woman gives birth on road after govt hospital in Bihar refuses to admit her
319.article_body: A 26-year-old woman was allegedly forced to give birth on the road after staff at a government hospital in Bihar's Siwan denied her admission on Friday night. The woman said a nurse took ₹1,000 and gave her two injections to reduce her pain. When the woman refused to give more money, she was allegedly pushed out of the hospital.

320.title: Taiwan not part of US, it's Chinese territory: China Foreign Minister
320.article_body: Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi on Sunday said that Taiwan isn't part of the US but Chinese territory. Yi, who made these remarks during a bilateral visit to Bangladesh, said China's actions on Taiwan have been just appropriate and legal. China has conducted several military exercises around Taiwan following US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's visit to the island.

321.title: Extremely heavy rainfall warning issued for several states, list released
321.article_body: The IMD, in its latest bulletin, issued extremely heavy rainfall warning for several states over the next few days. Some parts of Odisha and Chhattisgarh will likely get extremely heavy rainfall on August 9. It is also likely over Goa and parts of Maharashtra till August 11. It is predicted over Gujarat from August 9 to 11.

322.title: I'm incredibly tidy, she's very messy: Rishi Sunak on wife Akshata Murthy
322.article_body: Britain's Prime Ministerial candidate Rishi Sunak has revealed in an interview that he is "much more organised" than his wife Akshata Murthy who, according to him, is "more spontaneous". "I'm incredibly tidy, she's very messy," said Sunak, adding, "She is not big on the whole tidying thing." He said, "She is a total nightmare, clothes everywhere."

323.title: SEBI approved 28 firms' IPOs worth ₹45,000 in April-July 2022
323.article_body: SEBI has given its nod to 28 companies to raise ₹45,000 crore in funds through IPOs in April-July 2022. So far in FY23, 11 companies have launched their IPOs to raise ₹33,254 crore. Of this, the largest share (₹20,557 crore) was raised by Life Insurance Corporation's IPO. A total of 52 companies launched IPOs worth ₹1.11 lakh crore in FY22.

324.title: Delhi sees 2,423 new COVID cases, positivity rate highest since Jan 22
324.article_body: Delhi on Sunday reported 2,423 fresh COVID-19 cases, while the positivity rate jumped to 14.97%, the highest since January 22 this year. The city also logged two deaths due to COVID-19 and the number of active cases rose to 8,045 in the last 24 hours. Delhi on Saturday recorded 2,311 COVID-19 cases with a positivity rate of 13.84%.

325.title: India to bowl first in CWG gold medal match against Australia, playing XI announced
325.article_body: Australia captain Meg Lanning won the toss and elected to bat first against India in the first-ever women's T20I cricket final at CWG. India are playing with the same playing XI they fielded against England in the semi-final. India and Australia have played 25 women's T20Is against each other, out of which India have won six.

326.title: Woman dies after being hit by speeding luxury car in Kolkata
326.article_body: A woman died after she was allegedly hit by a speeding car in the Ballygunge area of south Kolkata on Sunday. The deceased, Sasthi Das (45), was standing on the side of Ballygunge Circular Road when a red-coloured luxury car hit her before ramming into another car, police said. The accused driver, stated to be a young woman, was arrested.

327.title: Bangladesh seeks China's assistance to repatriate Rohingya refugees
327.article_body: Bangladesh on Sunday sought China's assistance in sending Rohingya refugees back to Myanmar during a visit by Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi to Dhaka. Bangladesh, which houses over 9 lakh Rohingya refugees, has cited security concerns as the reason to seek repatriation of these refugees. Notably, China brokered a November 2017 agreement to repatriate about 7 lakh Rohingya refugees.

328.title: What a way to establish India's dominance: Sisodia on CWG gold, silver in triple jump
328.article_body: Reacting to Indian athletes winning gold and silver medals and finishing fourth in men's triple jump final at CWG 2022, Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia tweeted, "What a way to establish our nation's dominance at the triple jump event of the Commonwealth Games!" Eldhose Paul won gold (17.03m), while Abdulla Aboobacker bagged silver (17.02m). Praveen Chithravel finished fourth (16.89m).

329.title: Who's Dr Kalaiselvi, the 1st woman chief of India’s largest research organisation CSIR?
329.article_body: Dr Nallathamby Kalaiselvi was appointed as the first female Director General of the Council of Scientific and Industrial Research (CSIR), India's largest research organisation. She's a decorated scientist from Tamil Nadu, known for work on lithium-ion batteries. She was recognised as the International Scientist of the Year in 2007 and has 125 research papers and six patents to her name.

330.title: CM Gehlot has made fun of Nirbhaya, says her mother on his remarks
330.article_body: Nirbhaya's mother Asha Devi reacted to Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot's remarks that the incidents of murder after rape have increased due to the law on the hanging of culprits after the Nirbhaya case. "He (CM Gehlot) has made fun of Nirbhaya," she said. She added, "It's a very embarrassing statement, this is painful."

331.title: Living in Delhi for 20 years, never got prize money or help from Delhi govt: Divya Kakran
331.article_body: Indian wrestler Divya Kakran, who bagged bronze medal at CWG 2022, stated that she has been living in Delhi for the last 20 years but Delhi government has never given her prize money or helped her. "I request [Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal] that I should be honoured the same way other Delhi athletes, who even represent other states, are felicitated."

332.title: Saif told me, 'be on your toes, they're top actors': Kareena on Jaideep, Vijay
332.article_body: Kareena Kapoor opened up about sharing screen space with Jaideep Ahlawat and Vijay Varma in the upcoming Sujoy Ghosh directorial. She said working with Jaideep and Vijay has really transformed her. Recalling her actor-husband Saif Ali Khan's advice, Kareena said, "[He] was like, 'You need to be on your toes because these guys are in top form, they're top actors'."

333.title: 32-year-old farmer drowns in pond while taking bath in UP's Etah
333.article_body: A 32-year-old man drowned in a pond while taking a bath in Phaphotu village in Uttar Pradesh's Etah district on Sunday. The deceased, Kamlesh, allegedly ventured into deep water and drowned, police said. The deceased's body was recovered from the pond by the villagers, police added. Notably, Kamlesh used to work as a farmer.

334.title: Mom told me 'Don't get into acting, this life isn't comfortable': Janhvi
334.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor in an interview revealed that her late actress-mother Sridevi had advised her not to get into acting. "She said, 'I've worked my whole life so that I could give my kids...comfortable life and this life isn't comfortable, so why do you want to put yourself through it?'," Janhvi said, adding, "I said, 'I can't live without being...actor'."

335.title: 8 bogies of goods train derail on Delhi-Rohtak rail line in Haryana
335.article_body: At least eight bogies of a goods train were derailed on the Delhi-Rohtak railway line at a station in Haryana on Sunday. No one was injured in the incident. The railway traffic was affected for several hours. The goods train was headed from Shakur Basti in Delhi to Suratgarh via Rohtak.

336.title: Satwiksairaj-Chirag reach their 2nd consecutive gold medal match at CWG
336.article_body: Satwiksairaj Rankireddy and Chirag Shetty have reached their second consecutive men's doubles final in the badminton event at Commonwealth Games in Birmingham on Sunday. The Indian duo defeated Tan Kian Meng and Chan Peng Soon of Malaysia 21-6, 21-15 in the semi-final. The 2018 silver medallists will play in the gold medal match on Monday.

337.title: 1 dead, 2 injured after signboard falls on road in Chennai's Guindy
337.article_body: At least one person died and two others were left injured after a signboard fell on Guindy's Kathipara Bridge in Chennai on Sunday, police officials said. The incident further led to an accident of a government bus, minivan, auto and a bike, police said. The accident caused heavy congestion on the bridge, following which traffic police were deployed.

338.title: India are well placed to upset Australia in CWG finals: Chopra
338.article_body: Former India batter Anjum Chopra has said that the Indian women's cricket team are "well placed to upset Australia" in the CWG 2022 finals on Sunday. "I would say India can defeat the world champions (Australia)," Chopra said. She added, "The good thing is India knows what Australia's strengths are and they played well in the first game [of CWG]."

339.title: Several passengers injured as bus falls into gorge in Mussoorie
339.article_body: A roadways bus fell into a gorge near ITBP camp on Mussoorie-Dehradun road on Sunday, injuring several passengers. The bus was on its way to Dehradun from Mussoorie and was carrying nearly 39 passengers. Personnel of the ITBP Academy rushed to the spot and took seriously injured persons to the ITBP Academy Hospital.

340.title: Boy dies after life support withdrawn following legal battle in UK
340.article_body: A 12-year-old boy who had been in a coma for four months died at a London hospital on Saturday after doctors ended life-sustaining treatment. This comes after British courts rejected both requests of Archie Battersbee's family on extending his treatment and moving him to a hospice. Archie had been declared brain-stem dead by doctors in April.

341.title: Indian boy gets ₹1cr scholarship to study at US University with 16 Nobel-winning alumni
341.article_body: An 18-year-old Hyderabad boy has secured a ₹1.3 crore scholarship to study Neuroscience and Psychology at the Case Western Reserve University in the USA. Vedant Anandwade will enrol in the undergraduate pre-med course at the college that has produced 16 Nobel prize winners. Vedant said he applied for a career development program which helped him to get into the university.

342.title: India win silver in men's TT doubles as Sharath Kamal bags his 11th medal in CWG history
342.article_body: Indian table tennis players Sharath Kamal Achanta and Sathiyan Gnanasekaran bagged silver medal in men's doubles event at CWG 2022 on Sunday. They lost to England's Paul Drinkhall and Liam Pitchford in the final. With this, Sharath Kamal has now bagged 11 medals in the history of CWG, including five gold, three silver and three bronze medals.

343.title: India announce playing XI for 5th T20I against WI, Pandya leading in absence of Rohit
343.article_body: India stand-in captain Hardik Pandya won the toss and elected to bat first against West Indies in the fifth T20I in Florida. India have made four changes to their playing XI, with Ishan Kishan, Shreyas Iyer, Hardik and Kuldeep Yadav replacing Rishabh Pant, Suryakumar Yadav, Rohit Sharma and Bhuvneshwar Kumar. India lead the five-match series 3-1.

344.title: It's like making 'Mughal-e-Azam' again: Aamir on remaking 'Forrest Gump'
344.article_body: Aamir Khan has reacted after 'Laal Singh Chaddha' writer Atul Kulkarni said the actor didn't read his script for two years. Aamir said he was worried because it was Atul's first script. "Also, a film like Forrest Gump, which is...a cult classic...is very difficult to imagine to adapt...It's like making Mughal-e-Azam...again...But when I heard it, I was blown," he added.

345.title: PSG win 5-0 in their 1st game of 2022-23 Ligue 1; Messi scores bicycle-kick goal
345.article_body: Paris Saint-Germain began their Ligue 1 title defence by defeating Clermont by 5-0 on Saturday. In PSG's first top-flight match of this season, Lionel Messi scored two goals, including a bicycle-kick goal. Meanwhile, Morocco's Achraf Hakimi and Brazil's Neymar and Marquinhos scored a goal each. Barring Messi, all three players scored before half-time.

346.title: Reward effort, not outcomes: Google CEO's advice to students
346.article_body: Google CEO Sundar Pichai, while speaking with MBA students at US' Stanford University, said, "Be okay with failure and reward effort, not outcomes." "People tend to reward outcomes, which means over time, the organisation becomes more conservative...So a lot of scaling is about making sure you preserve the good things you had in the early days," he added.

347.title: Guj Cong to merge with Guj BJP, ILU-ILU will end: Arvind Kejriwal
347.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Sunday said the Congress will soon merge with the ruling BJP in Gujarat and spoke about a "brewing love" between the two camps. "ILU-ILU of BJP-Congress will end. On one hand, there is 27 years of misrule of the BJP and on the other hand, there is new politics of AAP," Kejriwal said.

348.title: India's federal structure became role model during COVID-19: PM
348.article_body: During the 7th Governing Council meeting of NITI Aayog in New Delhi, PM Narendra Modi said that "India's federal structure and cooperative federalism emerged as a model for the world during the COVID-19 crisis." At the meeting, PM Modi expressed the importance of agriculture diversification and the need to be self-sufficient, especially in edible oils.

349.title: The 36-yr-old has shown age is but a number: Anurag on racewalker Sandeep
349.article_body: Sports Minister Anurag Thakur said Indian racewalker Sandeep Kumar's bronze medal in men's 10,000 metres race walk final at CWG 2022 is a glowing example of sheer hard work with single-minded purpose. "The 36-year-old has shown that age is but a number and all that matters is matching potential with performance," he added. Sandeep clocked 38:49.21 in final on Sunday.

350.title: Treesa-Gayatri lose in women's doubles semis, to play for CWG bronze tonight
350.article_body: Indian duo of Treesa Jolly and Gayatri Gopichand lost in the semi-final of women's doubles badminton event at the Commonwealth Games 2022 today. Pearly Tan and Thinaah Muralitharan of Malaysia beat the Indian team 21-13, 21-16.
