Treesa and Gayatri will face Hsuan-Yu Chen Wendy and Gronya Somerville of Australia in the bronze medal match tonight.

351.title: Parents kill 5-yr-old daughter while performing black magic in Maha
351.article_body: The parents of a five-year-old girl allegedly beat her to death, while performing black magic on her to drive away evil forces in Maharashtra's Nagpur, police said on Sunday. The girl's parents, along with her aunt, performed the act and also filmed it, in which they were seen slapping and thrashing the five-year-old girl, an official said.

352.title: Russian journalist held in Kosovo on spying suspicion, released later
352.article_body: A Russian journalist was arrested in Kosovo on suspicion of espionage, Kosovo's Interior Minister Xhelal Sveçla said on Saturday. The journalist, Daria Aslamova, who reportedly works for a Russian tabloid newspaper, was quoted by her outlet as saying that she had been released and was now in Serbia. Notably, Russia doesn't recognise the ex-Serbian breakaway province of Kosovo as independent.

353.title: Nikhat wins as 2 Indian female boxers bag gold in a CWG edition for 1st time
353.article_body: Indian boxer Nikhat Zareen defeated Northern Ireland boxer Carly McNaul in the final of the women's over 48kg-50kg (light fly) category to bag gold at CWG 2022. Earlier today, Nitu Ghanghas bagged gold medal in the women's over 45kg-48kg (minimumweight) category. This is the first time in history that two Indian female boxers bagged gold medals in a CWG edition.

354.title: President congratulates Eldhose, Aboobacker on winning gold & silver at CWG
354.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu on Sunday congratulated Eldhose Paul and Abdulla Aboobacker on winning gold and silver respectively in the men's triple jump at CWG 2022 and said, "History created!". India won both gold and silver medals in this category at the CWG. Paul won the medal with a best jump of 17.03 metre, while Aboobacker jumped 17.02 metre.

355.title: Scientists create world's 1st ‘synthetic embryos’ without eggs & sperm, pic released
355.article_body: Scientists at the Weizmann Institute in Israel have created the world's first 'synthetic embryos' without using eggs, sperm or fertilisation. The embryos were assembled in a lab by collecting stem cells from mice and placing them in a special incubator which mimicked a mother's womb. While most cells failed to form anything, around 0.5% combined to form embryo-like structures.

356.title: Delhi govt to open 500 liquor vends by Sept 1, 200 more by end-Dec: Report
356.article_body: The Delhi government is likely to set up and operate 500 liquor vends from September 1 and open 200 more liquor vends by end-December, according to a report by Delhi government's sub-committee. Of these 700 stores, four Delhi government undertakings will run operations at five premium outlets. Out of these five vends, two are likely to be opened by end-August.

357.title: CM flying squad raids club serving flavoured hookah in Gurugram
357.article_body: A joint team of the CM's flying squad and the excise department raided a club serving flavoured hookah without permission in Gurugram, officials said on Sunday. The police also arrested one person and seized 13 hookah pots, reports said. Flying squad Inspector Harish Kumar said that the operator charged ₹1,000 per hookah pot.

358.title: Started 'Kaho...' shoot few days after this: Ameesha on old pic with Hrithik
358.article_body: Ameesha Patel took to Instagram to share a throwback picture featuring her and Hrithik Roshan. She wrote, "Hrithik and me in house I grew up in...both our families...were at my home celebrating before starting...shoot of 'Kaho Naa Pyaar Hai'...we started filming few days after this picture." The film, which marked Ameesha and Hrithik's debut in Bollywood, was released in 2000.

359.title: Some thought I was leaving India: Adnan Sami on his 'Alvida' post
359.article_body: Singer Adnan Sami opened up about how his fans reacted to his 'Alvida' post on Instagram. "Some...thought I was leaving social media, some thought I was leaving India...and some thought...I was leaving life," he said. Adnan added a lot of people asked him to be strong. He recently archived all his posts on Instagram and shared a video titled 'Alvida'.

360.title: I think Manchester United should let Ronaldo go: Wayne Rooney
360.article_body: Former England skipper Wayne Rooney has said that Manchester United should let 37-year-old Cristiano Ronaldo leave their club. "Ronaldo can play in any team," Rooney said. He added, "United aren't ready to challenge for the title now, so the aim has to be to build a team that can win the league in the next three-four years."

361.title: BJP is waiving off big industrialists' loans worth crores: Digvijaya
361.article_body: Congress MP Digvijaya Singh has alleged that BJP is strictly recovering loan amounts from poor farmers while they are waiving off the loans, worth crores of rupees, taken by big industrialists. "This is the fight of Congress against Modi-BJP...You tell whether Modi-BJP is with farmers or corporates...poor or rich?" Digvijaya tweeted.

362.title: 18-year-old Aarya Walvekar crowned Miss India USA 2022
362.article_body: Indian American Aarya Walvekar has been crowned Miss India USA 2022 at the pageant held in New Jersey, USA. The 18-year-old aspiring actress was crowned the winner of the 40th edition of the longest-running Indian pageant outside of India. University of Virginia premedical student Saumya Sharma was declared the first runner-up. New Jersey's Sanjana Chekuri was the second runner-up.

363.title: Neighbours fight over parrot in Pune, non-cognizable offence filed
363.article_body: Pune Police on Friday registered a non-cognizable offence, after two neighbours in the Shivajinagar area quarrelled over a pet parrot owned by one of them. The complainant, who is a 72-year-old man, stated that the bird makes noises all the time. He alleged the neighbour threatened to harm him when he asked him to take it to another place.

364.title: Hindu outfits celebrate BBMP order on Bengaluru's Idgah ground
364.article_body: Hindu outfits in Bengaluru gathered in Bengaluru's Chamarajpet near the Idgah maidan after the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) said the Idgah ground in Bengaluru belongs to the Revenue Department. The groups burst crackers and distributed sweets to locals. BBMP Joint Commissioner (west) SM Srinivasa said the Wakf board failed to claim the rights of the land.

365.title: Guarantee to remain in power for 5 yrs if elected in Guj: Kejriwal
365.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) National Convener Arvind Kejriwal on Sunday said that the party will serve a complete term if voted to power in Gujarat. "When you buy a TV, you get a guarantee of 2 years. But, if you [choose us], you get a guarantee of 5 years," he said. Assembly polls in Gujarat will be held this year.

366.title: Post offices to open on all days for Har Ghar Tiranga campaign till Aug 15
366.article_body: Under 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign, all post offices in India will be open on all days before Independence Day to facilitate the sale and delivery of national flags, the Central government has announced. Special arrangements will be made for the delivery of the national flags in all delivery post offices. PM Narendra Modi launched 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign last month.

367.title: Indian women's 4x100 metres relay team finishes 5th at CWG 2022
367.article_body: Indian women's 4x100 metres relay team of Dutee Chand, Hima Das, Srabani Nanda and Jyothi Yarraji finished fifth in the final at the Commonwealth Games 2022 in Birmingham on Sunday. The Indian team clocked 43.81 seconds. Nigeria won the gold medal with a timing of 42.10 seconds. England took the silver (42.41s), while Jamaica won the bronze (43.08s)

368.title: Fake policeman levies fines on violators with real policemen in Assam; arrested
368.article_body: A man posing as a traffic police officer in Assam's Sonitpur was arrested after he was caught levying fines on violators along with real, on-duty police personnel. After getting off from a bus in Tezpur city, he immediately called policemen present there and started collecting fines. He was arrested after junior policemen grew suspicious and called their seniors.

369.title: Woman raped by 4 while filling form at public service centre in UP
369.article_body: A woman was allegedly gangraped by four men in Uttar Pradesh's Mathura when she went to a public service centre to fill out a form for the post of an Anganwadi worker. The centre's operator, a computer operator, a shop owner and another man allegedly sexually assaulted the woman. They also recorded the act and sent it to her in-laws.

370.title: BJP worker arrested for assaulting woman in UP's Bareilly
370.article_body: A BJP worker was arrested in Bareilly, Uttar Pradesh, for allegedly assaulting a woman. The accused, Jitendra Rastogi, is a BJP worker but doesn't hold any post in the party, city President M Arora said. Rastogi also used to hold the post of state General Secretary in Uttar Pradesh Udyog Vyapar Mandal before being expelled from it, police said.

371.title: PM's Pak-origin rakhi sister sends rakhi to him, says 'Hope he calls me to Delhi'
371.article_body: PM Narendra Modi's Pakistani-origin rakhi sister Qamar Mohsin Shaikh sent rakhi to him and wished him for the 2024 general elections. "I hope he'll call me to Delhi this time. I've done all the preparations. I made this rakhi by myself by using a 'reshmi' ribbon with embroidery design," she said. "There's no doubt...he'll be the PM again," she added.

372.title: Mumbai man sexually assaults 9-yr-old daughter & 5-yr-old son, held
372.article_body: Mumbai's Meghwadi Police have arrested a man for allegedly sexually assaulting his 9-year-old daughter and 5-year-old son. The accused's wife filed the complaint and revealed that her husband sexually assaulted the girl when she had gone out for some work on June 25. The accused beat his daughter when she resisted and also assaulted his son, an official said.

373.title: 2 people killed after tree falls on bike on Pune-Nashik highway
373.article_body: Two people were killed after a tree fell on the bike they were riding on the Pune-Nashik highway on Saturday, police said. The deceased, Samadhan Nathu Patil and Nilesh Rajesh Shingale, were wearing helmets but still sustained several injuries that led to their deaths. "It was a large tree on the roadside, which collapsed all of a sudden," police said.

374.title: Bihar to release certain prisoners to commemorate 76th I-Day
374.article_body: The Bihar government has decided to release a certain section of prisoners who have served half their jail terms to commemorate the country's 76th Independence Day. A screening committee of the state home department has been instructed to review records of eligible prisoners for the remission scheme. Notably, Assam will remit the jail terms of 18 prisoners by Independence Day.

375.title: Hyd man beats 3-year-old daughter with a spoon for disobeying him
375.article_body: A three-year-old girl in Hyderabad is battling for life after her father beat her with a spoon for disobeying him. The accused found the girl standing in the washroom for a long time, following which he beat her with a spoon and pushed his wife to the floor, said Katna Sathaiah, SHO Saifabad police station.

376.title: Sindhu, Lakshya to fight for CWG gold in singles events; Srikanth to fight for bronze
376.article_body: Indian shuttlers PV Sindhu and Lakshya Sen reached finals of their respective women's and men's singles events at CWG 2022. Sindhu defeated Singapore's Yeo Jia Min to reach the women's singles final, while Lakshya beat Singapore's Jason Teh to reach men's singles final. Meanwhile, Kidambi Srikanth will fight for bronze medal after losing his semi-final against Malaysia's Ng Tze Yong.

377.title: TMC censors Kunal Ghosh for commenting against Partha Chatterjee
377.article_body: TMC West Bengal General Secretary Kunal Ghosh has been censored by the party for 14 days for commenting against suspended party leader Partha Chatterjee. Chatterjee and his aide Arpita Mukherjee have been sent to jail for 14 days in the School Service Commission appointments scam case. ED claimed to have recovered ₹49.8 crore in cash from flats owned by Chatterjee.

378.title: Congratulations for bringing laurels: Amit Shah to Panghal on his CWG gold
378.article_body: Taking to Twitter following Indian boxer Amit Panghal's gold medal win at Commonwealth Games 2022, Home Minister Amit Shah wrote, "Congratulations to Panghal for bringing laurels to the nation by clinching the gold medal at the CWG." He added, "The entire nation is celebrating his historic accomplishment." This is the 26-year-old's maiden gold medal at Commonwealth Games.

379.title: Sreeja misses medal in women's TT after losing bronze medal match at CWG
379.article_body: Indian table tennis player Sreeja Akula on Sunday lost her women's table tennis singles bronze medal match 3-4 at the ongoing 2022 CWG against Australia's Yangzi Liu. Akula lost the match with a scoreline of 11-3, 6-11, 2-11, 11-7, 13-15, 11-9, 7-11. Earlier, defending champion Manika Batra had lost in the quarter-final of women's singles.

380.title: Felt happy to beat a Pakistani player: Wrestler Naveen after CWG gold win
380.article_body: Following his gold medal in men's freestyle 74 kg event at CWG 2022, Indian wrestler Naveen said he's very happy, adding he prepared well and executed it. "I played without any pressure and felt happy to beat a Pakistani player. My next target is Asian Games and 2024 Olympics," he further said. The 19-year-old beat Muhammad Sharif Tahir in final.

381.title: India's digital identity is a clear opportunity for us: Singapore FM
381.article_body: Singapore Foreign Minister Vivian Balakrishnan said what India has done with digital identity and payment systems is a clear opportunity for Singapore. "We're reviewing ASEAN-India Trade in Goods Agreement to facilitate trade, to facilitate customs clearance and to reduce friction for goods' movement between Indian subcontinent and Southeast Asia. We have got quite a lot of work there," he added.

382.title: The show will not stop: Asit Modi on Shailesh's exit from 'Taarak...'
382.article_body: 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah' producer Asit Kumarr Modi has reacted to Shailesh Lodha's exit from the show, saying he wants to keep everyone in the team together. "There are a few people who don't want to come back...I want them to think again. But without them, the show won't stop," he added. Shailesh played the role of Taarak Mehta.

383.title: PM Modi urges startups to take part in handloom challenge
383.article_body: PM Narendra Modi has urged youngsters associated with startups to participate in the Handloom Startup Grand Challenge. In a bid to pay tribute to India's cultural diversity, Ministry of Textiles has launched the challenge inviting entrepreneurs and innovators to offer cost-effective tech solutions to increase production, quality of Indian handloom. Centre has offered cash prizes worth ₹10,50,000.

384.title: 7 exotic animals rescued, 2 wildlife traffickers arrested in Meghalaya
384.article_body: Police rescued seven highly endangered exotic wildlife species and arrested two wildlife traffickers in Meghalaya. Police detained a Guwahati-bound tourist taxi from Mizoram after receiving inputs. The rescued animals include two Hoolock gibbons, a Great Indian Hornbill, two Grey Langurs, one Phayre's leaf monkey and an Otter. The rescued wildlife was handed over to the Range Forest Officer.

385.title: Annu Rani wins India's first-ever medal in women's javelin throw in CWG history
385.article_body: India's 29-year-old javelin thrower Annu Rani on Sunday created history by bagging India's first-ever medal in women's javelin throw in the history of CWG. Annu bagged the bronze medal at CWG 2022 with a best throw of 60 metres. Meanwhile, another Indian javelin thrower Shilpa Rani finished seventh in the event.

386.title: Sandeep Kumar records his personal best timing, bags bronze in men's 10,000m race walk
386.article_body: Indian racewalker Sandeep Kumar bagged a bronze medal in men's 10,000m race walk event at CWG 2022. The 36-year-old clocked his personal best timing of 38:49.21 to finish third in the event. His previous personal best timing in 10,000m race walk was 46:55.97. Earlier, India bagged silver medal in women's 10,000m race walk event with Priyanka Goswami finishing second.

387.title: Women power all the way: Yuvraj on Indian women's hockey team's bronze at CWG
387.article_body: Yuvraj Singh took to Twitter to congratulate the Indian women's hockey team following their bronze medal win at Commonwealth Games 2022 on Sunday and wrote, "Women power all the way." He also congratulated all other Indian athletes for "consistently winning medals" at the ongoing Games. India beat New Zealand 2-1 in the penalty shootout in the bronze medal match.

388.title: I'll keep him for variety regardless of who sits out: Ravi Shastri
388.article_body: Ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri has said pacer Arshdeep Singh should play for Team India in the upcoming T20 World Cup. "I'll keep Arshdeep for variety regardless of who sits out. I'd pick three right-armers and one left-armer along with all-rounder Hardik Pandya," he stated. "[Arshdeep] will be an ideal foil when you look at the Indian attack," added Shastri.

389.title: Hard earned bronze for the Indian girls: Sehwag on hockey medal at CWG
389.article_body: Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag has congratulated the Indian women's hockey team for winning the bronze medal at the ongoing 2022 CWG. "Brilliant. A hard earned bronze for the Indian girls...The spirit with which you fought was such a joy to see," tweeted Sehwag. The Indian team has bagged a medal in women's hockey after 16 years.

390.title: 35-yr-old rapes film artist on pretext of marriage in Mumbai, held
390.article_body: A 35-year-old Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation staffer was arrested on Saturday for allegedly raping a film artist on the pretext of marriage, a Mumbai Police official said. The accused had been raping the 30-year-old woman since 2016, after promising to marry her, the official said quoting the complaint. He stopped taking her calls when she got pregnant, the official added.

391.title: Kerala HC directs NHAI to fix potholes after death of a man
391.article_body: After a man died in Kochi, Kerala HC directed the National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) to fill the potholes immediately. This comes after a scooter rider died in an accident in Ernakulam due to a pothole on Friday. Kerala PWD Minister blamed contractors for the pothole-ridden National Highway.

392.title: 100 citizens walk with 75m flag to mark 75th Independence Day in B'luru
392.article_body: Residents of Bengaluru's HSR Layout walked with a 75-metre-long Indian flag on Sunday morning to mark India's 75th Independence Day. Over 100 participants, including children and senior citizens, walked almost three kilometres from Somasundarapalya Lake to Haralur Lake. The residents' group shared a video of the walkathon on Twitter as part of the Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav campaign.

393.title: Social media firms need to enable voluntary user verification: Govt
393.article_body: Social media platforms are required to enable users to voluntarily verify their accounts, Minister of State for Electronics and IT Rajeev Chandrasekhar said. The voluntarily verified users must also be provided with visible verification marks, he added. We're aware of the risk and danger posed by growing phenomenon of misinformation, bots, criminality and users' harm in general, he said.

394.title: Nigerian man wanted in drugs case found dead in Thane forest
394.article_body: A Nigerian man, wanted in connection with a drugs case, was found dead after a police chase in a forest in Thane city, an official from city police said on Sunday. The deceased had several cases of drug possession registered against him and his wife had also been arrested by the police in Mumbai, the official added.

395.title: Plan to check air pollution in Delhi-NCR to come into force on Oct 1
395.article_body: Anti-air pollution measures followed in Delhi and its neighbourhood according to the severity of situation will come into effect on October 1 this year, which is 15 days before the usual date. The revamped Graded Response Action Plan focuses on the implementation of restrictions based on forecasts. Among other restrictions, it recommends a ban on use of coal and firewood.

396.title: Excited to meet PM Modi: Para TT player Bhavina after CWG 2022 gold win
396.article_body: Para table tennis player Bhavina Patel said she's excited to meet PM Narendra Modi following her gold medal win at CWG 2022. Talking about her performance, Bhavina said, "I'm happy with my performance. The way I trained for this really showed in my game." On Saturday, Bhavina became the first-ever Indian to win gold in para table tennis at CWG.

397.title: Our girls are shining the brightest: Gambhir on Nitu's gold, women's hockey bronze
397.article_body: Reacting to boxer Nitu Ghanghas winning gold and the women's hockey team bagging bronze at the CWG 2022, ex-India opener Gautam Gambhir tweeted, "Our girls are shining the brightest!" Nitu won gold after defeating World Championships 2019 bronze medallist Demie-Jade Resztan of England in the final of over 45kg-48kg (minimumweight) category. Indian women's hockey team defeated New Zealand 2-1.

398.title: Institutions captured, democracy gasping for breath: P Chidambaram
398.article_body: Congress leader P Chidambaram on Sunday said that he is veering to the "painful conclusion" that the Parliament has become "dysfunctional". "Institutions have been tamed or emasculated or captured," Chidambaram added. "Democracy is gasping for breath. We may have the shell of democracy but inside, the shell has been hollowed out," the Congress leader stated.

399.title: Zomato rejects EY's lower share price valuation for Blinkit deal
399.article_body: Zomato has rejected revised valuation report by EY that lowered its share price for acquiring hyperlocal delivery company Blinkit for ₹4,447 crore. In a statement, Zomato said fair market value per equity share of the company would remain ₹70.76. In first valuation report, EY had priced Zomato at ₹70.76 per share. The new report was based on a different methodology.

400.title: 21% Keralites above 30 prone to serious diseases: Govt survey
400.article_body: Around 21% people were found to be prone to serious diseases after the Kerala Health Department screened 7 lakh people aged above 30 years for the prevalence of lifestyle diseases. State Health Minister Veena George said that 8,982 persons had been found at the risk of tuberculosis, 8,614 with uterine cancer, 47,549 with breast cancer, and 3,006 with colon cancer.

401.title: Three puppies die after getting stuck in borewell for 29 hrs in Punjab
401.article_body: Three puppies died after being stuck in a borewell for around 29 hours in Punjab's Kharar. National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) and police teams had been called after the puppies had fallen into the borewell. According to reports, earthmovers and pipes to supply oxygen were used during the rescue operations but the puppies couldn't be saved.

402.title: For me, she's a Devi: Akshay Kumar on his bond with sister Alka Bhatia
402.article_body: Akshay Kumar, who'll soon be seen in Aanand L Rai's 'Raksha Bandhan', spoke about his bond with his sister Alka Bhatia. "Since childhood, my parents have taught me...my sister isn't just my sister but a Devi...For me, she's a Devi," he said. Akshay further said his sister doesn't fight at all and remains calm even if his temper rises sometimes.

403.title: Musical event on to celebrate Har Ghar Tiranga campaign in Delhi
403.article_body: Flag Foundation of India organised a musical event in Delhi's Connaught Place to celebrate the Centre's Har Ghar Tiranga campaign on August 6 and 7. Flag Foundation of India is a non-profit body founded by former MP Naveen Jindal to promote the National Flag. People were seen waving the flag in CP to mark 75 years of India's Independence.
